title: Continuous-Variable Quantum Teleportation with Squeezed States
description: Teleports coherent state quantum information using EPR-entangled squeezed vacuum beams and homodyne detection with feedforward correction
physics_explanation: Two OPA crystals pumped by the same laser with a 90-degree phase difference generate EPR-entangled squeezed vacuum modes with orthogonal squeezing orientations, creating quantum correlations in position and momentum quadratures. Alice performs a joint Bell measurement on the input coherent state and her EPR mode using two homodyne detectors measuring X and P quadratures. The measurement results are processed by classical feedforward electronics and sent to Bob, who applies displacement operations to his EPR mode. This reconstructs the input state at Bob's location with fidelity exceeding the classical limit of 0.5, demonstrating quantum teleportation of continuous-variable states.

component_justifications.1064nm Master Laser: Provides coherent pump light for both OPA crystals, ensuring the generated squeezed modes share phase coherence necessary for EPR entanglement
component_justifications.Main BS: Splits pump laser to simultaneously drive both OPA crystals with identical phase reference, crucial for creating correlated squeezed states
component_justifications.OPA Phase B: Introduces 90-degree phase shift to OPA Crystal B pump beam, creating orthogonal squeezing orientation (P-squeezed) relative to Crystal A (X-squeezed), essential for EPR entanglement with ΔX_A·ΔP_B < 1
component_justifications.OPA Crystal A: Optical parametric amplifier generating position-squeezed vacuum (Alice's EPR mode) through degenerate down-conversion below threshold
component_justifications.OPA Crystal B: Second OPA generating momentum-squeezed vacuum (Bob's EPR mode) with 90-degree phase offset from Crystal A, creating orthogonal squeezing for proper EPR correlations
component_justifications.Mirror A1: Directs Alice's squeezed mode toward EPR beam splitter
component_justifications.Mirror B1: Directs Bob's squeezed mode toward EPR beam splitter
component_justifications.EPR BS: Creates EPR entanglement by mixing the two orthogonally-squeezed vacuum modes, producing position-momentum entangled beams with ΔX_A·ΔP_B < 1
component_justifications.Alice EPR Mirror: Routes Alice's EPR mode toward Bell measurement beam splitter where it will interfere with the input state
component_justifications.Bob EPR Mirror: Directs Bob's EPR mode to await feedforward displacement corrections based on Alice's measurement results
component_justifications.Input State Laser: Generates weak coherent state |α⟩ to be teleported, encoding quantum information in quadrature amplitudes
component_justifications.State Modulator: Encodes information onto the input coherent state by modulating its quadratures to create the unknown state to be teleported
component_justifications.Bell Measurement BS: Combines Alice's EPR mode with the input state for joint measurement, projecting onto Bell-like basis in continuous-variable phase space
component_justifications.Homodyne X: Measures position quadrature (X) of the combined Alice-input mode, providing first classical measurement result for feedforward
component_justifications.Homodyne P: Measures momentum quadrature (P) of the combined Alice-input mode, providing complementary measurement result orthogonal to X
component_justifications.LO Splitter: Divides local oscillator beam from master laser to provide phase references for all three homodyne detectors
component_justifications.LO Mirror 1: Routes local oscillator beam along bottom of optical table toward homodyne detection regions
component_justifications.LO Mirror 2: Continues local oscillator path distribution to all three homodyne detectors
component_justifications.LO BS X: Mixes local oscillator with signal beam for Homodyne X detector, enabling interference-based quadrature measurement
component_justifications.LO Phase X: Sets measurement quadrature angle for X measurement (0 degrees) by controlling relative phase between LO and signal
component_justifications.LO Mirror X: Delivers phase-adjusted local oscillator to Homodyne X detector
component_justifications.LO BS P: Mixes local oscillator with signal beam for Homodyne P detector
component_justifications.LO Phase P: Sets measurement quadrature angle for P measurement (90 degrees, orthogonal to X) for complementary quadrature measurement
component_justifications.LO Mirror P: Delivers phase-adjusted local oscillator to Homodyne P detector
component_justifications.Bob Mirror 1: Routes Bob's EPR mode to displacement modulators where feedforward corrections will be applied
component_justifications.Displacement X: Applies position displacement to Bob's mode based on Alice's X measurement result, controlled by classical feedforward electronics
component_justifications.Displacement P: Applies momentum displacement to Bob's mode based on Alice's P measurement result, completing the teleportation protocol
component_justifications.Output Verification: Homodyne detector to verify teleportation fidelity by measuring quadratures of the reconstructed state and comparing to input
component_justifications.LO BS Out: Provides local oscillator for output verification homodyne detector
component_justifications.LO Phase Out: Allows scanning of measurement quadrature to fully characterize the teleported state and reconstruct its Wigner function

expected_outcome: Teleportation fidelity F > 0.5 (classical limit) is achieved, with F approaching 2/3 for infinite squeezing. With 10dB squeezing, expect F ≈ 0.58-0.62. Quadrature correlation measurements show X_out = X_in and P_out = P_in within quantum noise limits determined by EPR entanglement quality. The EPR variance V_EPR = ΔX_A·ΔP_B < 1 confirms entanglement resource. Scanning the output homodyne phase reconstructs the Wigner function of the teleported state, demonstrating faithful transfer of quantum coherence and verifying that Bob's output state matches Alice's input state.
